result.markdown:
--- title: "Getting started" description: | How to use the `edibble` system to construct a design of an experiment. date: "2022-04-24" --- The `edibble` system is an R-package to build a design of an experiment. To use the system, you will need to install the free, open-source programming language [R](https://www.r-project.org/) [If you would like to read more R, I recommend that you check out the [R for data science community](https://www.rfordatasci.com/).]{.aside} and install the package: ```r install.packages("edibble") ``` or you can install the developmental version with: ```r install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("emitanaka/edibble") ``` ```r library(edibble) design() %>% set_units(unit = 10) ```
``` {.markdown code-preview="/examples/example-02.qmd"} --- title: "Habits" author: "John Doe" format: {{< meta slide-format >}} --- ``` ``` {.markdown code-preview="/examples/_example-01.qmd"} --- title: "Habits" author: "John Doe" format: {{< meta slide-format >}} --- ## Getting up - Turn off alarm - Get out of bed ## Going to sleep - Get in bed - Count sheep ```
